articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description: Even if you don't game, the data is in, and the impact of the Steam Deck on Linux is massive. We'll go into details and then share our long-term review of the Deck. Special Guests: Alex Kretzschmar and Listener Jeff.
articles.title: 529: Changing the Game

articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description: Today's theme is data sovereignty, and we'll check in with two crucial projects that are giving you more options. Special Guest: Noah Chelliah.
articles.title: 528: Where's Your Data?

articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description: Brent's new Framework laptop has been torn apart and put back together again. We'll find out if it's up to his standards. Plus, we're kicking off a new build.
articles.title: 527: Framing Brent

articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description: While chaos is brewing in SUSE and Red Hat land, Canonical stays the course and doubles down on the Linux desktop. Plus, our thoughts on the kernel team GPL-blocking NVIDIA.
articles.title: 526: Canonical Wins by Default

articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description: We daily drive Asahi Linux on a MacBook, chat about how the team beat Apple to a major GPU milestone, and an easy way to self-host open-source ChatGPT alternatives. Special Guest: Neal Gompa.
articles.title: 525: Beating Apple to the Sauce

articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description: The painful side of making video games, Grinder's big problems, and Google's sneakiest trojan horse.
articles.title: 536: Grindr-in-Chief

articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description: Did Apple's event live up to our expectations? And our thoughts on what new goodies for developers might be in the new hardware and software.
articles.title: 535: Locally Sourced Carbon Neutral Consumer

articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description: Azure suffers a big outage, and Microsoft blames faulty automation; why we think there might be early signs of weak demand for Apple's Vision Pro and more.
articles.title: 534: Blame the Automation

articles.author: Jupiter Broadcasting
articles.description:
U.S. officials are warning open-source software could be a cyber security threat. Their solution? Money. But do we want them picking the winners and losers of open source?
Plus, Mike's thoughts after using Cursor AI and a Cornell study take generated code to the shed.
articles.title: 533: Critical Failure in Open Source
